TopicTitle: What do you think IVA needs?

Articles.Content:
Apart from the mk1 inline and mk3 cockpits needing an actual IVA, what features would you like to see added?

Edit: Suggestions so far:

Movement inside and between capsules

Fuel/Resource Gauges

Orbital/Flight Info

Panic ButtonTM

Ground contact indicator (for touchdowns)

Functional Pitch/Roll/Yaw Indicators

Ship Diagram (for pizza)

Would you like more info such as fuel levels or a diagram of your ship? (I believe both of those are available in the Raster Prop Monitor mod, but what about stock?)

Or would you like to be able to control more, maybe having a big, red button that says 'TO SPACE!'?

Perhaps all of the above and more?

Please post what you would like to see added to the game

Personally I think the more the merrier (within reason, a movable picture of Uri Kerman may be a bit unnecessary) because it's a feature that is used as much as the player wants, and if you don't want to interact with Uri's picture you don't have to (as opposed to a feature like the atmosphere that affects all).

Cheers,

Cas.

At some point it would be cool to move from one module to another without EVA... The way the parts are designed it looks like it will be possible but the UI could be weird. Id also love if the Science lab had some real playable things going on that made science more interesting.
RPM and the ability to fly fully from the IVA view as well as first person EVA.

RPM and the ability to fly fully from the IVA view as well as first person EVA.

Kind of that, or at least periapsis and apospsis display.

The 2-man lander-can instrumentation needs to be completed, there's just an empty panel above the window.

Manually flying around inside the modules in 1st view would be great

A button that when you right clicked a kerbal in their seat, it would say get out of seat. Then you could go around floating in command pods (and other parts) aimlessly and being able to right click the doors at the back of the cockpits to go to whatever is behind it. I would also enjoy being able to open up a small cabnet (like the rock box in the mk2 lander can).
A Panic button would be sweet. There should be a solution when kerbals in doubt. Aka C4.
Definitely being able to move around, but only when the ship is stable. Like in space stations.
A contact indicator light so you know when you've touched down without exiting IVA (which is cheating!).

Please, oh please, move the console in the Cupola Module!

This might be helpful: http://www.nasa.gov/sites/default/files/images/755812main_iss_view_full_full.jpg

Probably my main gripe in some of the cockpits (can't remember which ones but I think it's mk2) is that the pitch, roll and yaw indicators are inverted for some reason, and there is a display with them on that does nothing.

Also I think in all capsules these indicators only show user input, as opposed to SAS as well.

Cas.

Really I never use it. It's just a huge waste of memory space.

If I allow my imagination to fly uncontrolled I would like to design my own dashboard and interior the same way I design a spacecraft.

For example, you don't actually need a navball in an atmospheric plane, you need an artificial horizon and a compass.

Ultimately I wish I had a set of instruments and install them as I see fit (it will also allow me to fly in a more Kerballish way, for example, if I forget to install an altimeter, or a speed indicator, or a navball).

RPM is very nice, I suppose, but it gives everything for free while I think that everything must come at a price - each instrument you use should add to weight (because aside from an indicator per se you need room for actual sensors, wires, electronics, etc within your ship), consume extra power (same reason), etc.

Moreover, each instrument should have 'precision' - you can buy a 'bargain-price' altimeter which can only guess +/- 100 m or a hi-end one which has +/- 0.001 m precision. (they should differ in price or be upgradeable the same way the buildings currently are.

Internally KSP measures everything very precisely, but it is not necessary that a player should get all this precision 'for free'.

P.S. That point about precision is about all indicators, not only in IVA but normal (camera view) HUD as well.
